required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real World Assessment of People Living With Chronic Hepatitis B in Australia
clinical_study.official_title: Real World Assessment of People Living With Chronic Hepatitis B in Australia

brief_summary.textblock: The REACH-B study establishes an observational cohort study of people living with chronic hepatitis B from a national network, including a diverse range of services, to characterise and monitor hepatitis B linkage to care and treatment requirements amongst this population.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants presenting to participating clinics for HBV care within the previous 12 months will be identified and enrolment data will be collected including demographics, laboratory parameters, liver disease assessment, treatment history and clinical management. Follow-up data on HBV treatment and clinical management, liver disease stage and laboratory parameters will be collected at each subsequent visit or at minimum every 12 months.

primary_outcome.description: To characterise and monitor hepatitis B linkage to care and treatment requirements amongst people living with chronic hepatitis B

secondary_outcome.description: To characterise the socio-demographic spectrum of people living with chronic HBV
To assess the proportion of individuals in each phase of the disease, based on the natural history of hepatitis B infection
To assess the proportion of individuals who are eligible for each recommended hepatitis B clinical care level
To monitor the uptake of recommended hepatitis B clinical care, including antiviral treatment
To monitor the adherence to recommended hepatitis B care, including the patterns of antiviral use and cessation
To assess the rate of surveillance for hepatocellular carcinoma
To assess the rate of progression from each phase to the subsequent phase of hepatitis B
To assess the rate of liver fibrosis progression, including the development of cirrhosis, decompensated cirrhosis, and hepatocellular carcinoma

arm_group.description: Patients with chronic hepatitis B infection as defined by HBV surface antigen positive

study_pop.textblock: Adults diagnosed with chronic HBV as defined by a positive HBsAg result at participating sites will be enrolled in the cohort. Participants can be newly diagnosed or existing patients of the service. Data on HBV disease status, liver disease status, HBV monitoring and treatment will be collected six monthly from enrolment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. All individuals diagnosed with chronic hepatitis B in the participating study sites are eligible to be included (both newly diagnosed cases and those diagnosed in the past).
2. 16 years of age or older.
3. Attended the health service for HBV care within the prior 12 months from study commencement (retrospective recruitment) OR Attending the health service for HBV care from study commencement (prospective recruitment)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Nil
